rComments: Excellent and nice prof! Unlike the other earth science prof, Terry is very hands-on which is why he has practicals instead of tutorials. Unfortunately, UTM has decided to replace him because he is not as "academic" as the other profs. Considering it is EARTH SCIENCE, one would figure a hands-on approach would be more valuable than an academic one.

I had Terry for a few Earth Sciences classes a while back and he is an amazing prof.  He helps his students out so much whether it's understanding the material presented or looking to connect with professionals with industry.  I have never met another prof who cares about his students as much as Terry does.  I enjoyed all his classes!

Bottrill is awesome!! You have to make an effort to talk to him and get to know him. Then he will be so good to you! He loves Geology and is passionate about what he does. Any time I was struggling or something wasn't working for me, I'd talk to him and we'd work through it.   Incredible prof!!!

Overall, he is a good prof Easy marks for the presentation as long as u do something origina Tests are easy, make sureou go to class to get all his buble charts since half of his tests are out of those charts. Do the questions at the end of the chapter and memorize the answers and u'll get a good mark!

Prof may be boring during the lecture but as long as you FILL IN EVERY SINGLE CONCEPT CHART and have SOME understanding of the materials you WILL ace the course.   TL;DR  Boring prof but piss easy course
Very boring, but easy to understand, he is extremely helpful when approached

This professor is fantastic and passionate about what he does. He prefers to be called by his first name Terry and if you talk to him often he will help you out. He takes all questions from the textbook (you must get it) and puts them on the test. Just memorizing the answers in the back of the book you will do well.

Misleading, the tests are pretty unfair, it's not always easy to understand what he's saying during a lecture. His concept charts make studying for his tests much, much harder. When he posts concept charts for the next lecture, he posts at ridiculous and inconvenient times, too late in the evening for people to print out.

His 203 class is awesome, his 202 class becomes very difficult halfway through. You will have to work to get a good grade. Nonetheless, Terry is a great guy with great stories. He helps his students and will answer any question without making you feel stupid. Take 203 (you will get used to the microscopes), but avoid 202 if possible.
He mumbles a lot to himself. His notes that he posts aren't the greatest which forces you to attend the lectures. His tests weren't really fair either. But still a manageable course.
